main event: An unidentified flying object was observed at Bear Mountain State Park in New York on December 18, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as round and silver to brown, approximately 175 feet in diameter., The object hovered before accelerating and disappearing from sight., The observation lasted for 6-7 seconds and occurred under clear weather conditions., There exists a photographic analysis that negated double exposure and retouching., The analysis concluded that the object appeared to be circular in form with a defined 'superstructure.'
sighted object: circular object, silver to brown in color
witness description: The witness was a 23-year-old civilian labor foreman, considered reliable.
